title: Peshawar
summary: Peshawar (/pəˈʃɑːwər/;[5] Pashto: پېښور‎ [peˈçəwər] (listen); Hindko: پشور‎; [pɪˈʃɔːɾ] (listen); Urdu: پشاور‎ [peˈʃaːʋər] (listen)) is the capital of the Pakistani province of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and its largest city.[6] It is the sixth-largest city in Pakistan,[7] and the largest Pashtun-majority city in the country.[8][9] Situated in the broad Valley of Peshawar east of the historic Khyber Pass, close to the border with Afghanistan, Peshawar's recorded history dates back to at least 539 BCE, making it the oldest city in Pakistan and one of the oldest cities in South Asia.[10]
